## Register a New User

This endpoint registers a new user in the system by accepting user details and creating an account.

**Method:** `POST`  
**URL:** `http://localhost:4000/api/v1/auth/register`

---

### Request Body

The request body must be sent as **raw JSON** with the following fields:

| Field | Type | Description |
|---|---|---|
| `username` | string | The desired username for the new account |
| `email` | string | The user's email address (must be unique) |
| `password` | string | The password for the account |
| `role` | string | The role assigned to the user (e.g., `admin`, `user`) |

**Example:**
```json
{
  "username": "bhanu",
  "email": "bhanu@test.com",
  "password": "123456",
  "role": "admin"
}
```

---

### Expected Response

**Status Code:** `201 Created`

```json
{
  "message": "User Registered Successfully!"
}
```

The response confirms that the user has been successfully registered in the system.

## Login

Authenticates an existing user and returns a JWT token upon successful login.

**Endpoint:** `POST /api/v1/auth/login`

---

### Request Body

Send a JSON object with the following fields:

| Field | Type | Required | Description |
|-------|------|----------|-------------|
| `email` | string | ✅ Yes | The registered email address of the user |
| `password` | string | ✅ Yes | The user's password |

**Example:**
```json
{
  "email": "bhanu@test.com",
  "password": "123456"
}
```

---

### Response

On success, returns a `200 OK` with a success message and a JWT token:

```json
{
  "message": "User Logged In Successfully!",
  "token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..."
}
```

| Field | Type | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| `message` | string | Confirmation message indicating successful login |
| `token` | string | A signed JWT token to be used for authenticating subsequent requests |

> **Note:** Include the returned `token` in the `Authorization` header as `Bearer <token>` for all protected endpoints.

## Create Note

Creates a new note for the authenticated user. The note is associated with the owner's account and stored with a unique ID and timestamps.

---

### Endpoint

`POST http://localhost:4000/api/v1/notes`

---

### Request Body

Send a JSON object with the following fields:

| Field     | Type   | Required | Description                        |
|-----------|--------|----------|------------------------------------|
| `title`   | String | Yes      | The title of the note              |
| `content` | String | Yes      | The main body/content of the note  |

**Example:**
```json
{
  "title": "First Note",
  "content": "Testing API from Postman"
}
```

---

### Response

**Status Code:** `201 Created`

Returns the newly created note object with server-generated fields.

| Field       | Type   | Description                                      |
|-------------|--------|--------------------------------------------------|
| `_id`       | String | Unique identifier for the note (MongoDB ObjectId)|
| `title`     | String | The title of the note                            |
| `content`   | String | The content/body of the note                     |
| `owner`     | String | The ID of the user who created the note          |
| `createdAt` | String | ISO 8601 timestamp of when the note was created  |
| `updatedAt` | String | ISO 8601 timestamp of the last update            |

**Example Response:**
```json
{
  "title": "First Note",
  "content": "Testing API from Postman",
  "owner": "6999c85fb49ad9a8de00c63d",
  "_id": "6999c8d8b49ad9a8de00c640",
  "createdAt": "2026-02-21T15:01:44.164Z",
  "updatedAt": "2026-02-21T15:01:44.164Z",
  "__v": 0
}
```

## Get Notes

Retrieves a list of notes stored in the system for a user but If an admin tries it it'll list out all the notes. This endpoint returns every note along with its owner's details.

**Method:** `GET`  
**URL:** `http://localhost:4000/api/v1/notes`

---

## Response Structure

The response is a JSON array of note objects. Each object contains the following fields:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `_id` | string | Unique identifier for the note |
| `title` | string | Title of the note |
| `content` | string | Body/content of the note |
| `owner` | object | Details of the user who created the note |
| `owner._id` | string | Unique identifier of the owner |
| `owner.username` | string | Username of the owner |
| `owner.email` | string | Email address of the owner |
| `createdAt` | string (ISO 8601) | Timestamp when the note was created |
| `updatedAt` | string (ISO 8601) | Timestamp when the note was last updated |
| `__v` | number | Internal version key (used by MongoDB) |

---

## Example Response

``` json
[
  {
    "_id": "6999c512b49ad9a8de00c622",
    "title": "Aman Here",
    "content": "GO n get Ice cream",
    "owner": {
      "_id": "6999c0e3b49ad9a8de00c5ec",
      "username": "Aman",
      "email": "aman@gmail.com"
    },
    "createdAt": "2026-02-21T14:45:38.700Z",
    "updatedAt": "2026-02-21T14:45:38.700Z",
    "__v": 0
  },
  {
    "_id": "6999c8d8b49ad9a8de00c640",
    "title": "First Note",
    "content": "Testing API from Postman",
    "owner": {
      "_id": "6999c85fb49ad9a8de00c63d",
      "username": "bhanu",
      "email": "bhanu@test.com"
    },
    "createdAt": "2026-02-21T15:01:44.164Z",
    "updatedAt": "2026-02-21T15:01:44.164Z",
    "__v": 0
  }
]

 ```

## Update Note

Updates an existing note by its unique ID. You can modify fields such as the `title` and/or `content` of the note.

---

### Method
`PUT`

### URL Pattern
```
http://localhost:4000/api/v1/notes/:id
```

> Replace `:id` with the actual note ID you want to update.

---

### Request Body

Send a JSON object with the fields you want to update.

| Field     | Type   | Required | Description                        |
|-----------|--------|----------|------------------------------------|
| `title`   | string | Optional | The new title for the note         |
| `content` | string | Optional | The new content/body of the note   |

**Example Request Body:**
```json
{
  "title": "Updated Title"
}
```

---

### Example Response

**Status:** `200 OK`

```json
{
  "_id": "6999c512b49ad9a8de00c622",
  "title": "Updated Title",
  "content": "GO n get Ice cream",
  "owner": "6999c0e3b49ad9a8de00c5ec",
  "createdAt": "2026-02-21T14:45:38.700Z",
  "updatedAt": "2026-02-21T15:05:27.457Z",
  "__v": 0
}
```

The response returns the full updated note object, including the `updatedAt` timestamp reflecting the time of the update.

## Delete Note

Deletes a specific note permanently from the system using its unique ID. Once deleted, the note cannot be recovered.

---

### Method & Endpoint

```
DELETE /api/v1/notes/:id
```

---

### Path Parameters

| Parameter | Type   | Required | Description                              |
|-----------|--------|----------|------------------------------------------|
| `id`      | string | Yes      | The unique identifier of the note to delete. |

**Example:**
```
DELETE /api/v1/notes/6999c512b49ad9a8de00c622
```

---

### Example Response

**Status:** `200 OK`

```json
{
  "message": "Note deleted"
}
```

---

### Notes
- Returns `200 OK` with a confirmation message upon successful deletion.
- Ensure the note ID provided exists; otherwise, the API may return a `404 Not Found` error.

## Get All Users

Retrieves a list of **all registered users** in the system. This is an **admin-only** endpoint and should only be accessible to users with the `admin` role.

---

### Endpoint

```
GET /api/v1/auth/admin/users
```

---

### Response

Returns an **array of user objects**. Each object contains the following fields:

| Field | Type | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| `_id` | `string` | Unique identifier for the user (MongoDB ObjectId) |
| `username` | `string` | The display name of the user |
| `email` | `string` | The email address of the user |
| `role` | `string` | The role assigned to the user (`user` or `admin`) |
| `__v` | `number` | Internal version key (MongoDB) |

---

### Example Response

```json
[
  {
    "_id": "699952acaa33972e97a560ba",
    "username": "Utsav",
    "email": "utsav@gmail.com",
    "role": "user",
    "__v": 0
  },
  {
    "_id": "69995533bfe8f2caff99203d",
    "username": "Nikhil",
    "email": "nikhil@gmail.com",
    "role": "admin",
    "__v": 0
  }
]
```

---

> ⚠️ **Admin Access Required:** This endpoint is restricted to admin users only. Ensure the request is made with valid admin credentials or an appropriate authorization token.
